title: In a bizarre twist, Windows OS is now supporting a vital iPhone feature
description: Microsoft announced that it's bringing iPhone support to Windows 11, specifically for iMessage.

title: 2023 could be the biggest ever year for cybercrime
description: Hackers are shifting strategies and opting for a stealthier approach, researchers claim.

title: This malware tool is still successfully exploiting Internet Explorer vulnerabilities
description: The browser you should absolutely not be using under any circumstances is in the iron grip of an exploit kit.

title: Realme's new Android phone charges to 100% faster than you can finish a coffee
description: The Realme GT 3 launch at MWC heralds blisteringly-fast 240W fast charging for the masses.

title: LG confirms its G3 TV has next-gen OLED tech, teases Samsung-beating brightness
description: LG is normally coy about the technology in its OLED TVs, but it's finally confirmed that it's using Micro Lens Array screens.

title: Stolen Activision data now freely available on hacking forum
description: Masses of sensitive employee data at videogame publisher Activision leaked for free on hacking forum.

title: The US Marshals have been hit by a major ransomware attack
description: A "stand-alone USMS system" was affected, the department confirms, with employee data accessed.

title: The first headphones with MQA's next-gen hi-res audio are coming, but not this year
description: New wireless tech is said to be better quality and more scalable than anything so far, and this headphones collaboration is its first hint at reality.

title: Nothing Phone (2) confirmed to get a big power boost from a Snapdragon 8
description: The Nothing Phone (2) will use a powerful Snapdragon 8 series chipset, but at what cost?

title: How Final Fantasy 16 is brought to life with PS5 hardware
description: Final Fantasy 16 benefits from the PS5's hardware to deliver the boldest and most detailed RPG adventure yet.

title: Project 007: everything we know so far
description: Project 007 is a new James Bond game in the works from IO Interactive, the masterminds behind the Hitman series.

title: LG announces US prices for its new OLED TVs, and there's mixed news
description: The LG C3 is a better deal this year, but other models have risen in price compared to their 2022 models.

title: A Xiaomi phone was fully recharged in under 5 minutes with 300W charging
description: Xiaomi has demoed its Redmi Note 12 Pro Plus smartphones being charged from empty to full in under five minutes.

title: A stolen Android phone PIN could be used to change your Google account password
description: If they know your Android PIN, a thief could change your Google password and get access to all your data.

title: Richard Madden goes full James Bond in first look at Prime Video's Citadel TV show
description: Starring Richard Madden and Priyanka Chopra, Citadel is Amazon's attempts to build a James Bond-style TV spy universe.

title: Google Pixel Watch gets fall detection to add insult to Fitbit’s injuries
description: Google has announced that it's finally rolling out 'fall detection' for the Pixel Watch – but it's just tumbleweed for Fitbit fans.

title: Metal Gear Solid 6: everything we know so far
description: Metal Gear Solid 6 hasn't been officially confirmed but we've still gathered up the latest rumors and news.

title: Intel may have fixed one of Windows 11's biggest annoyances
description: Intel has dropped a new Bluetooth update that'll greatly improve user experience.

title: Microsoft has a new plan to make Edge better than Chrome
description: Chrome may be the dominant browser by far, but Microsoft is determined to find ways to help Edge catch up.

title: No, you still can't run Linux on an Apple M1 Mac - yet
description: Developers say they still need to unlock all Apple M1 Silicon features before they can release an operational Linux OS.

title: Pokémon Sleep is a sleep app I wasn’t expecting, and I’m kind of intrigued
description: Catch Pokémon while catching ZZZs? Pokémon Sleep could be a whole new way of improving your slumber.

title: LastPass reveals exactly how it was hacked
description: LastPass lays out the process by which its systems were infiltrated.

title: Jabra unveils new speakerphones targeting hybrid workers
description: Jabra now has a new range of speakerphones with portability in mind for the hybrid worker.

title: Halo Infinite update: season 3 release date, new content and patch notes
description: With each Halo Infinite update, 343 Industries is adding more and more to the sci-fi FPS experience.

title: Two in-development Meta Quest VR headsets may have just been canceled
description: Meta has reportedly canceled two VR headsets it was working on, likely what would have been the Quest Pro 2 and Quest 4.

title: NordVPN apps and servers confirmed as secure by independent auditors
description: Experts at Cure53 examined both its server infrastructure and app security, garnering a "robust impression" overall.

title: Bing chatbot just got smarter – and it’s about to get different AI personalities
description: Prepare yourself: Bing chatbot’s AI personalities are about to arrive, and there’ll be three of them initially.

title: This critical WordPress plugin flaw could let hackers hijack your website
description: Two WordPress plugin flaws discovered and patched, but hackers are still out there abusing them.

title: AI Bing is coming to chat up your Windows 11
description: Microsoft launches a huge Windows 11 update with AI Bing, Phone Link for iOS, Quick Assist, and video recording in Snipping Tool.

title: Salesforce could be set to cut even more jobs
description: Salesforce still needs to increase margins significantly, and reducing headcounts seems like a likely method.

title: Delayed Suicide Squad shooter gets Xbox Series X and PS5 performance confirmed
description: The Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League has been confirmed to be targetting 60fps on Xbox Series X and PS5.

title: Google Photos tricks like Magic Eraser are coming to your videos next
description: Google has strongly hinted that AI-powered editing tricks, like Magic Eraser, are in the pipeline for video shooters soon.

title: Zoom reckons it's going to be around for years to come
description: With revenue up and hybrid working continuing worldwide, Zoom sees no sign of slowdown just yet.

title: Obsidian game directors keen on Fallout New Vegas “graphical remaster”
description: Obsidian game directors are keen on the possibility of a graphical remaster for Fallout New Vegas.

title: Elon Musk might be working on an 'anti-woke' version of ChatGPT - and that sucks for AI
description: We could be seeing AI implemented across platforms very soon, and we’re not sure how to feel about it.

title: OnePlus is working on a foldable phone, and it’s launching this year
description: OnePlus has confirmed that its first foldable phone is on the way, and says it'll be at the 'pinnacle' of the foldable market.

title: This major encryption boost means that even Gmail can't read your emails
description: The release brings Google's email provider and calendar app up to speed with the rest of Google Workspace.

title: Mobile malware threats are slowly dwindling
description: Since a high in 2020, the number of incidents has declined - but that's no reason to relax.

title: 'They are right': The Mandalorian director admits some season 3 fan theories are true
description: The Mandalorian director Rick Famuyiwa suggests that some Star Wars fan theories about the show's third season are correct.

title: Microsoft Teams is finally putting an end to your potty mouth
description: No more filthy language on Microsoft Teams calls thanks to new profanity filters.

title: The Galaxy Ring could be Samsung's take on the health-tracking Oura Ring
description: Samsung might be working on a Galaxy Ring health monitor that would compete with the likes of the Oura Ring.

title: Human brain cells are trouncing computers in raw speed and power
description: The power of the human brain far exceeds a computer, according to science.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Tuesday, February 28 (game #400)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Apple may be reviving the iPhone SE 4 by taking a new approach for development
description: Apple is planning on equipping the mid-range phone with its new baseband chip, according to the latest rumors.

title: Oppo explains why cheaper folding phones aren't coming any time soon
description: We spoke to Oppo executives at MWC and they had a lot to say about the challenges of making a mid-range foldable
